intro: Hieracium tephrantheloides, commonly known as the tephrantheloid dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets, and it produces a puffball-like seed head for wind dispersal. Hieracium tephrantheloides is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes.
